location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: Black and white photograph of Joseph Falls, the husband of Reverend Montee Falls. He wears a suit and is angled to the camera. He acted as an assistant minister at Unity Center of Memphis, a Unity denomination church. He was a high school principal and a brick mason. He worked on a number of the buildings in downtown Memphis, Tennessee. He bought land in the Memphis, Tennessee community of Whitehaven and built his own home. He also owned houses and land in Cordova, another Memphis, Tennessee community.

titleInfo.title: Generations - African American Women's Early Activism in Tennessee
